services.title: Our Services
services.subtitle: We offer a full range of ophthalmological services to care for your vision with the highest quality and technology.

consultations.title: Ophthalmological Consultations
consultations.description: Complete assessment of your eye health, with accurate diagnosis and treatment.
consultations.fullDescription: Our ophthalmological consultations provide comprehensive eye health assessment, combining clinical experience with state-of-the-art technology. Each consultation includes detailed medical history, complete eye examination, intraocular pressure measurement, and fundus evaluation to ensure accurate diagnosis and personalized treatment.

refraction.title: Refraction Exams
refraction.description: High-precision determination of prescription for glasses and contact lenses.
refraction.fullDescription: Refraction exams utilize advanced technology to determine precise prescription for glasses and contact lenses. Our process includes computerized and subjective refraction, contact lens fitting with different materials and designs, and comprehensive adaptation training to ensure visual comfort and eye health.

specialized.title: Specialized Treatments
specialized.description: Treatment for glaucoma, cataracts, retinal diseases, and other eye conditions.
specialized.fullDescription: We offer advanced specialized treatments for various eye conditions, including clinical and surgical glaucoma management, diabetic retinopathy treatment, dry eye syndrome therapy, and macular degeneration follow-up. Each treatment plan is individualized based on patient needs and disease stage.

surgeries.title: Ophthalmological Surgeries
surgeries.description: Advanced surgical procedures to correct vision problems.
surgeries.fullDescription: Our surgical procedures employ microinvasive techniques and modern technology to ensure safety and effectiveness. We perform cataract surgery with intraocular lens implantation, refractive procedures, and glaucoma surgeries in an equipped surgical center with comprehensive pre and post-operative care.

pediatric.title: Pediatric Follow-up
pediatric.description: Specialized care for children's eye health, from birth.
pediatric.fullDescription: Pediatric ophthalmology requires specialized approach adapted to each child's age and development. Our service includes red reflex testing, visual development assessment, strabismus evaluation, and infant refraction in a playful and welcoming environment, ensuring early detection and treatment of visual problems.

reports.title: Specialized Reports
reports.description: Issuance of ophthalmological reports for exams, expert opinions, and other purposes.
reports.fullDescription: We provide specialized ophthalmological reports for various purposes including driver's license exams, public contests, occupational health assessments, and expert opinions. Each report follows rigorous technical criteria and includes digital signature for legal validity and professional acceptance.

gonioscopy.title: Gonioscopy
gonioscopy.description: Specialized exam to assess the drainage angle of the eye, essential for glaucoma diagnosis.
gonioscopy.fullDescription: Gonioscopy is a comprehensive examination that allows detailed visualization of the drainage angle structures of the eye. This exam is fundamental for glaucoma classification and treatment guidance, providing crucial information for therapeutic decision-making.

retinaMapping.title: Retina Mapping
retinaMapping.description: Complete evaluation of the retina, including the peripheral region, to detect lesions and diseases.
retinaMapping.fullDescription: Retina mapping is a detailed examination that evaluates the entire retinal surface, from the central region to the periphery. This exam is essential for early detection of retinal detachment, diabetic retinopathy, and other conditions that may compromise vision.

cornealTopography.title: Corneal Topography
cornealTopography.description: Detailed mapping of corneal curvature to diagnose keratoconus and plan refractive surgeries.
cornealTopography.fullDescription: Corneal topography is a precise examination that creates detailed maps of corneal curvature and elevation. This exam is essential for early diagnosis of keratoconus, refractive surgery planning, and specialized contact lens fitting.

pachymetry.title: Pachymetry
pachymetry.description: Precise measurement of corneal thickness, important for glaucoma diagnosis and refractive surgery evaluation.
pachymetry.fullDescription: Pachymetry is a quick and painless exam that measures corneal thickness at multiple points. This measurement is crucial for accurate interpretation of intraocular pressure and evaluation of candidacy for refractive surgeries.

retinography.title: Retinography
retinography.description: High-resolution digital photography of the retina for documentation and follow-up of eye diseases.
retinography.fullDescription: Retinography allows high-quality photographic documentation of the retina, enabling comparison over time and detailed monitoring of retinal diseases. It's essential for diabetic retinopathy follow-up and macular disease documentation.

visualField.title: Visual Field
visualField.description: Computerized exam that maps the field of vision to detect glaucoma and optic neuropathies.
visualField.fullDescription: Visual field testing is a comprehensive computerized examination that maps peripheral vision and detects visual defects. It's fundamental for glaucoma diagnosis and monitoring, as well as evaluation of optic neuropathies and neurological conditions.

benefits.licenseReports: Driver's license reports for all categories

preparation.consultation: Bring your current glasses and previous exams
preparation.refraction: Avoid using contact lenses 24h before the exam
preparation.specialized: Bring all exams and medications in use
preparation.gonioscopy: Avoid using contact lenses on the day of the exam
preparation.retinaMapping: Pupil dilation necessary - avoid driving after the exam
preparation.cornealTopography: Suspend contact lens use as per medical guidance
preparation.pachymetry: Suspend contact lenses 24h before the exam
preparation.visualField: Use your regular glasses and avoid visual fatigue before the exam

faq_items.question: How long does the adaptation process take?
faq_items.answer: Most patients adapt within 1-2 weeks with gradual daily wear increase.

faq_items.question: Are contact lenses safe for daily use?
faq_items.answer: Yes, when properly fitted and cared for, contact lenses are very safe.

faq_items.question: Can I wear lenses if I have astigmatism?
faq_items.answer: Absolutely! We offer specialized toric and rigid lenses for astigmatism correction.

glaucoma.title: Eye Health in Focus: Glaucoma
glaucoma.description: Understand what glaucoma is, how to spot warning signs, and the treatment options to protect your vision. An essential episode for those who want to prevent this silent disease.

catarata.title: Eye Health in Focus: Cataract
catarata.description: Discover everything about cataracts: causes, symptoms, treatments and how surgery can restore your quality of life. Accurate information for a conscious decision.

ptergio.title: Eye Health in Focus: Pterygium
ptergio.description: Learn about pterygium, its causes related to sun exposure and the available treatments. Know how to protect your eyes and when to seek medical help.

retina.title: Eye Health in Focus: Retina
retina.description: Main retinal conditions and how to prevent them to maintain healthy vision.

olho_seco.title: Dry Eye: Symptoms and Treatments
olho_seco.description: Causes, symptoms and treatment options to relieve discomfort and improve quality of life.

duvidas.title: Frequently Asked Questions in Ophthalmology
duvidas.description: Answers to the most common questions about consultations, exams, and treatments.

ceratocone.title: Eye Health in Focus: Keratoconus
ceratocone.description: What keratoconus is, symptoms, diagnosis, and treatment options including specialty contact lenses.

dmri.title: Eye Health in Focus: AMD — When the Macula Decides to Retire
dmri.description: Understand Age-related Macular Degeneration (AMD): main symptoms, risk factors, prevention tips and when to seek evaluation with your ophthalmologist.

lentes_contato.title: Eye Health in Focus: Contact Lenses — Rigid vs Soft
lentes_contato.description: Differences, indications and care between rigid and soft contact lenses. When each is recommended and how to maintain a safe, comfortable fit.

cirurgia_refrativa.description: Everything you need to know about refractive surgery: LASIK, PRK and other modern techniques to correct myopia, hyperopia and astigmatism. When it's indicated and what to expect from the procedure.

search.noResults: No questions found for your search.

consultation.question: How to schedule an appointment?
consultation.answer: You can schedule via WhatsApp, phone or through our website. We operate Monday to Friday from 8am to 6pm and Saturdays from 8am to 12pm.

services.question: What services do you offer?
services.answer: We offer complete ophthalmological consultations, refraction exams, specialized treatments, surgeries, pediatric follow-up and specialized reports.

insurance.question: Does Saraiva Vision accept health insurance?
insurance.answer: Yes. Saraiva Vision Ophthalmology in Caratinga accepts various health insurance plans, in addition to private consultations. Patients can confirm with the administrative team which health plans have coverage for consultations, exams and ophthalmological procedures. Insurance coverage facilitates access to preventive exams and treatments, reducing costs for patients. If your plan doesn't cover certain procedures, the clinic also offers accessible options for private care, always maintaining the standard of quality and safety in vision care.

preparation.question: How to prepare for the consultation?
preparation.answer: Bring your current glasses, previous exam reports and list of medications in use. Some exams may require pupil dilation.

location.question: Where are you located?
location.answer: We are located in downtown Caratinga, with easy access and parking available.

emergency.question: Do you handle ophthalmological emergencies?
emergency.answer: Yes, we handle ophthalmological emergencies. Contact us via WhatsApp or phone for priority care.

technology.question: What technologies do you use?
technology.answer: We use state-of-the-art equipment for precise diagnoses and effective treatments, including OCT, perimetry and surgical microscope.

followup.question: How does post-consultation follow-up work?
followup.answer: We offer continuous follow-up with scheduled returns and WhatsApp support for treatment-related questions.

lenses_cost.question: How much does contact lens fitting cost in Caratinga?
lenses_cost.answer: The cost of contact lens fitting in Caratinga varies according to the type of lens (soft, rigid or special for keratoconus), case complexity and included exams. At Saraiva Vision, the process involves ophthalmological consultation, fitting tests and initial follow-up to ensure comfort and clear vision. The cost is affordable and proportional to the safety offered, as proper fitting prevents complications like infections or eye discomfort. Investing in adequate fitting ensures visual health and long-term well-being.

pediatric_age.question: What's the ideal age to take a child to an ophthalmologist?
pediatric_age.answer: The first ophthalmological consultation should occur in the first year of life, around 6 months. Then, a new evaluation is recommended at 3 years and before literacy. In Caratinga, many parents seek Saraiva Vision to ensure their children don't have vision problems that could harm learning. Symptoms like getting too close to TV, frequently rubbing eyes or having difficulty seeing the blackboard are warning signs. Early detection prevents strabismus, amblyopia and refractive errors.

medical_report.question: How does the ophthalmological report exam work?
medical_report.answer: The ophthalmological report exam in Caratinga performed by Saraiva Vision follows rigorous technical criteria. It includes visual acuity, ocular motility assessment, color vision test, tonometry and fundus examination when necessary. The report is issued the same day, with legal validity and medical signature (CRM), being accepted by agencies like DETRAN, public tenders and admission processes. This document provides legal and clinical safety, confirming the patient's visual fitness for professional or licensing activities.

glaucoma_treatment.question: How long does glaucoma treatment take?
glaucoma_treatment.answer: Glaucoma treatment is continuous, as there is no definitive cure. The goal is to control intraocular pressure and preserve the optic nerve, preventing vision loss. Follow-up time depends on disease stage and treatment response, which may include eye drops, laser or surgery. At Saraiva Vision, each patient receives an individualized protocol with periodic consultations and optic nerve monitoring. Success depends on discipline in medication use and regular medical follow-up throughout life.

vision_symptoms.question: What symptoms indicate vision problems?
vision_symptoms.answer: Main symptoms of vision problems include: blurred vision, eye pain, difficulty reading up close or seeing far, redness, light sensitivity and frequent headaches. In children, signs include poor school performance, constant stumbling and excessive screen proximity. At Saraiva Vision, complete exams can identify from myopia, hyperopia and astigmatism to more serious diseases like glaucoma and cataracts. Seeking early care is fundamental to preserve vision and ensure quality of life.

privacy.title: Privacy Policy
privacy.intro: This policy explains how we process your personal data under the Brazilian LGPD (Law 13.709/2018).
privacy.data_item_contact: Contact data submitted via forms (name, email, phone).
privacy.data_item_cookies: Consent preferences and functional/analytics/marketing cookies (only if authorized).
privacy.purposes_desc: Customer support, scheduling, service improvement, aggregate metrics, and legitimate communications.
privacy.rights_desc: You may request access, correction, anonymization, portability, consent revocation and deletion: contact the DPO.
privacy.consent_desc: We process data based on your explicit consent when required. You can revoke anytime via 'Manage Cookies'.
privacy.dpo_desc: For rights requests or privacy questions email {{email}}.
privacy.security_desc: We apply reasonable technical and organizational controls (in‑transit encryption, access restriction).
privacy.retention_desc: We retain data only as long as needed for stated purposes or legal obligations, then delete or anonymize.
privacy.third_parties_desc: Hosting, analytics and communication providers – only as per disclosed purposes & legal bases.
privacy.updates_desc: We may update this policy; the revision date will always be shown.
privacy.form_consent_html: I agree with the processing of my data for contact and scheduling.
privacy.disclaimer: Information provided does not replace individual medical evaluation.
